an5.100:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambī, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
an5.100:1.3: At that time the Koliyan named Kakudha—Venerable Mahāmoggallāna’s supporter—had recently passed away and been reborn in a certain host of mind-made gods.
an5.100:1.4: His incarnation was two or three times the size of a Magadhan village with its fields.
an5.100:1.5: But with that incarnation he didn’t obstruct himself or others.
an5.100:2.1: Then the godling Kakudha went up to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him,
an5.100:2.2: “Sir, this fixed desire arose in Devadatta:
an5.100:2.4: And as that thought arose, Devadatta lost that psychic power.”
an5.100:2.5: That’s what the godling Kakudha said.
an5.100:2.6: Then he bowed and respectfully circled Mahāmoggallāna, keeping him on his right side, before vanishing right there.
an5.100:3.1: Then Mahāmoggallāna went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened.
an5.100:5.1: “But Moggallāna, did you encompass the godling Kakudha’s mind, and know that
an5.100:5.2: everything he says is correct and not otherwise?”
an5.100:5.7: Now that futile man Devadatta will expose himself by his own deeds.
an5.100:6.1: Moggallāna, there are these five teachers found in the world.
an5.100:6.3: Firstly, some teacher with impure conduct claims: ‘I am pure in ethics. My ethical conduct is pure, bright, uncorrupted.’
an5.100:6.5: ‘This teacher has impure ethical conduct, but claims to be ethically pure.
an5.100:6.6: They wouldn’t like it if we were to tell the laypeople.
an5.100:6.7: And how could we treat them in a way that they don’t like?
an5.100:6.8: But they consent to robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an5.100:6.9: They themselves will be recognized by their own deeds.’
an5.100:6.10: The disciples of such a teacher cover up their teacher’s conduct,
an5.100:6.11: and the teacher expects them to do so.
an5.100:7.1: Furthermore, some teacher with impure livelihood claims: ‘I am pure in livelihood. My livelihood is pure, bright, uncorrupted.’
an5.100:7.3: ‘This teacher has impure livelihood, but claims to have pure livelihood.
an5.100:7.4: They wouldn’t like it if we were to tell the laypeople.
an5.100:7.5: And how could we treat them in a way that they don’t like?
an5.100:7.6: But they consent to robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an5.100:7.7: They themselves will be recognized by their own deeds.’
an5.100:7.8: The disciples of such a teacher cover up their teacher’s livelihood,
an5.100:7.9: and the teacher expects them to do so.
an5.100:8.1: Furthermore, some teacher with impure teaching claims: ‘I am pure in teaching. My teaching is pure, bright, uncorrupted.’
an5.100:8.3: ‘This teacher has impure teaching, but claims to have pure teaching.
an5.100:8.4: They wouldn’t like it if we were to tell the laypeople.
an5.100:8.5: And how could we treat them in a way that they don’t like?
an5.100:8.6: But they consent to robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an5.100:8.7: They themselves will be recognized by their own deeds.’
an5.100:8.8: The disciples of such a teacher cover up their teacher’s teaching,
an5.100:8.9: and the teacher expects them to do so.
an5.100:9.1: Furthermore, some teacher with impure answers claims: ‘I am pure in how I answer. My answers are pure, bright, uncorrupted.’
an5.100:9.3: ‘This teacher has impure answers, but claims to have pure answers.
an5.100:9.4: They wouldn’t like it if we were to tell the laypeople.
an5.100:9.5: And how could we treat them in a way that they don’t like?
an5.100:9.6: But they consent to robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an5.100:9.7: They themselves will be recognized by their own deeds.’
an5.100:9.8: The disciples of such a teacher cover up their teacher’s answers,
an5.100:9.9: and the teacher expects them to do so.
an5.100:10.1: Furthermore, some teacher with impure knowledge and vision claims: ‘I am pure in knowledge and vision. My knowledge and vision are pure, bright, uncorrupted.’
an5.100:10.3: ‘This teacher has impure knowledge and vision, but claims to have pure knowledge and vision.
an5.100:10.4: They wouldn’t like it if we were to tell the laypeople.
an5.100:10.5: And how could we treat them in a way that they don’t like?
an5.100:10.6: But they consent to robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an5.100:10.7: They themselves will be recognized by their own deeds.’
an5.100:10.8: The disciples of such a teacher cover up their teacher’s knowledge and vision,
an5.100:10.9: and the teacher expects them to do so.
an5.100:10.10: These are the five teachers found in the world.
an5.100:11.1: But Moggallāna, I have pure ethical conduct, and I claim: ‘I am pure in ethical conduct. My ethical conduct is pure, bright, uncorrupted.’
an5.100:11.2: My disciples don’t cover up my conduct, and I don’t expect them to.
an5.100:11.3: I have pure livelihood, and I claim: ‘I am pure in livelihood. My livelihood is pure, bright, uncorrupted.’
an5.100:11.4: My disciples don’t cover up my livelihood, and I don’t expect them to.
an5.100:11.5: I have pure teaching, and I claim: ‘I am pure in teaching. My teaching is pure, bright, uncorrupted.’
an5.100:11.6: My disciples don’t cover up my teaching, and I don’t expect them to.
an5.100:11.7: I have pure answers, and I claim: ‘I am pure in how I answer. My answers are pure, bright, uncorrupted.’
an5.100:11.8: My disciples don’t cover up my answers, and I don’t expect them to.
an5.100:11.9: I have pure knowledge and vision, and I claim: ‘I am pure in knowledge and vision. My knowledge and vision are pure, bright, uncorrupted.’
an5.100:11.10: My disciples don’t cover up my knowledge and vision, and I don’t expect them to.”
